normalised: five G rollout gains momentum across India

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26th, 2023 – The rollout of 5G services across India is progressing at a rapid pace, with major telecom operators like Airtel and Jio expanding their networks to cover more cities and towns. The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) reported significant infrastructure upgrades in the past quarter, particularly in tier-II and tier-III cities.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty sixth, two thousand and twenty three – The rollout of five G services across India is progressing at a rapid pace, with major telecom operators like Airtel and Jio expanding their networks to cover more cities and towns. The Department of Telecommunications (D O T) reported significant infrastructure upgrades in the past quarter, particularly in tier-two and tier-three cities.

unnormalised: Bharti Airtel, in a press release, stated its 5G network now covers over 5000 towns and cities, while Reliance Jio is focusing on providing affordable 5G-enabled handsets. Both companies are aiming for pan-India coverage by the end of 2024.
normalised: Bharti Airtel, in a press release, stated its five G network now covers over five thousand towns and cities, while Reliance Jio is focusing on providing affordable five G-enabled handsets. Both companies are aiming for pan-India coverage by the end of two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: The Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Madras is playing a crucial role, developing indigenous 5G technologies. Experts believe the enhanced connectivity will revolutionize various sectors, from agriculture to healthcare. Rural areas are expected to benefit from improved access to telemedicine and online education.
normalised: The Indian Institute of Technology (I I T) Madras is playing a crucial role, developing indigenous five G technologies. Experts believe the enhanced connectivity will revolutionize various sectors, from agriculture to healthcare. Rural areas are expected to benefit from improved access to telemedicine and online education.

unnormalised: Analysts predict that 5G will add $450 billion to India's GDP by 2040. Similar to the transformative effect of mobile phones depicted in films like "Guru," 5G is poised to connect Bharat in unprecedented ways, boosting economic growth and enabling new possibilities. The initial investments in spectrum and infrastructure are estimated to be over Rs. 2.5 lakh crore. The government aims to lay 100,000 km of optical fiber cable this fiscal year to support the expansion.
normalised: Analysts predict that five G will add dollar four hundred and fifty billion to India's G D P by two thousand and forty. Similar to the transformative effect of mobile phones depicted in films like "Guru," five G is poised to connect Bharat in unprecedented ways, boosting economic growth and enabling new possibilities. The initial investments in spectrum and infrastructure are estimated to be over rupees two point five lakh crore. The government aims to lay one hundred thousand kilometer of optical fiber cable this fiscal year to support the expansion.
